H0.text: Pointed teeth are the teeth of a carnivore.

H1.text: Rounded teeth are the teeth of a carnivore that are mostly rounded.

H2.text: Wide teeth are characteristic of a carnivore, as its teeth are mostly wide.

H3.text: Flat teeth are mostly characteristic of a carnivore.

A4.text: Some scientists assert that sphenacodontoid synapsids such as Dimetrodon were the first terrestrial vertebrate to develop the curved, serrated teeth that enable a predator to eat prey much larger than itself.
